thread.title: Noah Lyles' Biggest Flaw to His World Record Beating Ambition Revealed - EssentiallySports
thread.title_full: Noah Lyles' Biggest Flaw to His World Record Beating Ambition Revealed - EssentiallySports

author: Nandini Makkar
title: Noah Lyles' Biggest Flaw to His World Record Beating Ambition Revealed - EssentiallySports
text:
Noah Lyles is one of the sprint athletes who etched close to the topmost benchmark established by Usain Bolt in the 100m run by clinching a 9.83 seconds record in comparison to Bolt’s 9.58. However, some recent revelations of this year’s anticipated world record athlete called attention to his biggest flaws in return. Amidst all disclosures, Usain Bolt too, is of a belief that Noah Lyles can be one of the contenders to break the world record this time in the Paris Olympics 2024. While Noah Lyles comprises the same dynamism as Usain Bolt, to win in the Summer Olympics this time, he hopes to etch his name in both 100m and 200m, surpassing the record that was formerly Usain Bolt’s.
Noah Lyles’ biggest mistake that could hinder his way to success ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
Underestimating the rest, Noah Lyles, according to Rodney Green explained Usain Bolt’s view in a recent interview by Ready Set Go in a YouTube Podcast. He said that the 8X Olympic gold medalist had explained, “He (Noah Lyles) often underestimates the rounds of the 100m, in comparison to the 200m.” Though he added that the possibilities are in favor of the 200, it’s stacked up against him in the 100.

The host also declared that it has been only Usain Bolt who has taken up gold medals for both 100 and 200m, however, it looks dicey that both could be cliched at a time when an athlete is full of sanguinity. “Now, he (Noah Lyles) didn’t say anything about the 100, I know he said it about the 200, but those rounds in that 100 were going to take out a lot on his body” added Gatlin.
Sighting the Paris Olympics 2024 Difficult to breakthrough the ongoing legacy of the Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, Noah Lyles aims to go past Usain Bolt’s 2009 world record in the 200m of 19.19s. Confident to achieve his goal this time, he sights his eyes on the 2024 Paris Olympics this season . Not to forget, in his recent interview with the CNN Sports, Noah Lyles had said, “ We worked on the 60 to help my 100 and my 200 and we’ve seen major progression in that. ”

Aiming to expand his athletic portfolio, Noah Lyles’s goal is to compete for four golds this season – 100m, 200m, 4x100m , and 4x400m races, a record which even Usain Bolt didn’t ever achieve during the same event. “ He was the fastest man ever to do it, and soon, it’ll be me.” , the American sprinter exclaimed with a sarcastic grin on his face,
Noah Lyles Discloses the Exact Moment That Wrote the ‘Biggest’ Part of His Career
